content: I propose that we allow more people permission to edit topics and change the streams of topics. It seems we fairly often want to do this, and it is sufficiently harmless that there is little risk.
One solution would be to allow everyone to do this.
Another is that there is a class of user called "moderator", which currently we don't seem to make use of. I could allow moderators this permission, then bump up a big cohort of people to that.

Scott Morrison said:

One solution would be to allow everyone to do this.

I agree that moving topics between streams does not need to be behind the moderator flag, but I would not want arbitrary users to have access to all the other things that moderators can do

I've changed the settings so that "Who can edit the topic of any message" and "Who can move messages between streams" is available to admins and moderators instead of just admins. We should probably make more people zulip moderators, at the very least the actual maintainers
Er, I guess that's what your second proposal was anyway. Hopefully I didn't step on any toes
Okay, I just promoted everyone in the "maintainers" user group to the "moderator" Zulip role.
The main effect of this, following Mario's change, is that now all @maintainers can edit topic titles, and change the streams of topics.

I don't think there's any particular reason that mathlib maintainers and zulip moderators need to coincide exactly, so if anyone wants to (self-)nominate zulip moderator status for someone, just say so.
